intro: Odontocarya uva-alba, commonly known as the white grape plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that resemble grapes, which are edible but have a mild, sweet taste. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found growing on rocky soils. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
